definition: area particularly hard-hit by a disaster/disaster area

sentences.english: The United States has been hit hard by the crisis.
sentences.chinese: 美国是此次经济危机的重灾区。

sentences.english: The earthquake-hit regions will be exempt from the hike, the central bank said.
sentences.chinese: 央行还表示地震重灾区法人金融机构暂不涨价。

sentences.english: 'So at least then we'll have a supply point close to the major damage.
sentences.chinese: 这样至少我们在离重灾区较近的地方有了一个军供点。

sentences.english: He plans to travel to some of the hardest hit areas, including the Irrawaddy Delta.
sentences.chinese: 他计划前往一些重灾区，包括伊落瓦底三角洲地区。

sentences.english: The west belongs to the heavy disaster area in our country, where man-made disasters are relatively serious.
sentences.chinese: 西部属于我国重灾区，而且，人为灾害相当严重。

sentences.english: Local education departments will improve studying and living conditions for students free of charge.
sentences.chinese: 教育部门将为重灾区考生无偿提供复习和生活条件。

sentences.english: Premier Wen Jiabao went to the hardest hit northern Sichuan Province, in the boat with solemn expression_rs.
sentences.chinese: 温总理赶往川北重灾区，坐船时表情凝重。

sentences.english: WHO officials say they are working to set up treatment centers in the worst affected areas.
sentences.chinese: 世卫组织官员说，他们正在重灾区设立医疗中心。

sentences.english: That's the option many homeowners took in hard-hit Northridge, Calif.
sentences.chinese: 加利福利亚的重灾区北岭的许多房主就是这样做的。

sentences.english: China's government is seeking to relocate the population of several entire towns in the areas worst-hit by the quake.
sentences.chinese: 中国政府正打算重新安置最重灾区几个城镇的居民。

sentences.english: It's a view shared on the streets of Mexico City, the hardest-hit area.
sentences.chinese: 这是墨西哥市流感重灾区街头流行的观点。

sentences.english: Mr. Ma likened the industry to a medical “disaster zone,” with frequent accidents.
sentences.chinese: 马副部长把美容业比作医疗事故频发的“重灾区”。

definition: (of diseases, accidents) to occur with a high incidence/(old) to score highly in the imperial exams
criminal ringleader, main offender (idiom); main culprit/fig. main cause of a disaster
more critical with every passing day
ever more critical/problems get more and more intense
to be in flood/to overflow (the banks)/to inundate/to spread unchecked
lit. to flood (idiom)/fig. rampant/in plague proportions
